Home > Writing > Articles

Austin.com

In 2013, I wrote a series of freelance articles and reviews for locally-focused site Austin.com:

  • Growing Pains for Greek Cuisine at Santorini Cafe – The recently opened Santorini Cafe isn't ready for prime time. – March 03, 2013
  • Movie Review: Jack the Giant Slayer – Jack tries to turn a folktale into an epic, but the results are inconsistent. – March 10, 2013
  • Checking Out Chinese Food at Asia Cafe – Asia Cafe is an excellent choice for authentic Chinese food on the north side of town. – March 25, 2013
  • Movie Review: Wrong – Drafthouse Films keeps things weird with Quentin Dupieux's Wrong. – April 04, 2013
  • Ramen Done Right at Ramen Tatsu-Ya – Popular new 'Japanese soul food' restaurant is busy but worth braving the crowds. – April 09, 2013
  • Theatre Review: Slowgirl at Hyde Park Theatre – Hyde Park Theatre presents a hilarious two-hander about a teenage girl, her uncle and their secrets. – April 18, 2013
  • Donuts Come With Everything at Gourdough's Public House – Gourdough's brings their signature 'big fat donuts' to a brick-and-mortar location with an expanded menu. – May 06, 2013
  • Movie Review: Star Trek: Into Darkness – JJ Abrams' second film in the rebooted Star Trek universe favors explosions over character development. – May 21, 2013
  • Austin Actors Shine in ZACH Theatre's 'Harvey' – The play, a light-hearted screwball classic, is the perfect vehicle for Zach Scott’s Martin Burke as Elwood P. Dowd, although Lauren Lane steals the show as Dowd’s sister Veta. – June 01, 2013

December 08, 2015
  writing    articles
Austin, TX, restaurants, movies, plays, reviews, and criticism
